Submodules¶

m4i_analytics.m4i.platform.PlatformApi module¶

class m4i_analytics.m4i.platform.PlatformApi.PlatformApi[source]¶

This class implements various API calls to functions provided by the M4I platform

static clone_branch(projectName, toBranch, userid, fromBranch='MASTER', parserName='archimate3')[source]¶

Clone an existing branch of your model into a new branch.

Returns:

A ModelCommit instance describing the clone operation. Note that the clone happens asynchronously on the server side. You can monitor the progress via query_model requests.
Return type:

ModelCommit
Parameters:
  • description (str) – Describe the purpose of this new branch.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project for which you want to clone branches.
  • toBranch (str) – The name of your new branch.
  • userid (str) – The name of the user creating the new branch.
  • fromBranch (str) – Optional. The name of the branch you wish to clone. Default is ‘MASTER’.
  • parserName (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model that will be contained in your new branch. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Default is ‘archimate3’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined or when the query result could not be parsed into a ModelCommit instance.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid or when the query result could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static commit_branch(fromBranch, projectName, toBranch, userid, parserName)[source]¶

Merge one of the branches of your model with another branch of your model, applying the changes in either to both.

Returns:

A ModelCommit instance describing the commit operation. Note that the commit happens asynchronously on the server side. You can monitor the progress via query_model requests.
Return type:

ModelCommit
Parameters:
  • description (str) – Describe the purpose of merging the branches.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project for which you want to merge branches.
  • toBranch (str) – The name of the target branch.
  • userid (str) – The name of the user creating the new branch.
  • fromBranch (str) – The name of the source branch.
  • parserName (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model that is contained in the target branch. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Default is ‘archimate3’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined or when the query result could not be parsed into a ModelCommit instance.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid or when the query result could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static commit_model(projectName, userid, description, model, contentType='archimate', module=None, parserName='archimate3')[source]¶

Commit a model to the M4I repository.

Returns:

A ModelCommit instance describing the commit operation. Note that the commit happens asynchronously on the server side. You can monitor the progress via query_model requests.
Return type:

ModelCommit
Parameters:
  • branchName (str) – The name of the branch to which you want to commit the model.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project to which you want to commit the model.
  • userid (str) – The id of the user committing the model.
  • description (str) – Describe the purpose of your commit.
  • model (file) – The file containing your model.
  • contentType (str) – Optional. The format in which you are committing the model. Valid options are: ‘archimate’, ‘json’ and ‘xml’. Default is ‘archimate’.
  • module (str) – Optional. The name of the module to which you want to commit. You can also define new modules this way. By leaving this empty, you commit to the complete model. Default is empty.
  • parserName (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model you are committing. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Default is ‘archimate3’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters (excluding module) is not defined or when the query result could not be parsed into a ModelCommit instance.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid or when the query result could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static force_commit(addListRight, description, deleteListLeft, deleteListRight, fromBranch, fromModelId, projectName, taskid, toBranch, toModelId, userid, contentType='archimate', module=None, parserName='archimate3')[source]¶

Commit a version of your model to the repository, and resolve any conflicts according to the provided parameters.

Returns:

A ModelCommit instance describing the commit operation. Note that the commit happens asynchronously on the server side. You can monitor the progress via query_model requests.
Return type:

ModelCommit
Parameters:
  • addListLeft (array<str>) – If there is a version conflict, and you wish to keep a particular newly added or otherwise modified element from the repository, you add the ID of that element to this list.
  • addListRight (array<str>) – If there is a version conflict, and you wish to keep a particular newly added or otherwise modified element from committed model, you add the ID of that element to this list.
  • description (str) – Describe the purpose of the commit.
  • deleteListLeft (array<str>) – If there is a version conflict, and you wish to delete a particular element from the repository, you add the ID of that element to this list.
  • deleteListRight (array<str>) – If there is a version conflict, and you wish to delete a particular element from the committed model, you add the ID of that element to this list.
  • fromBranch – The name of the source branch.
  • fromModelId (str) – The id of the model you wish to merge from. You can use this e.g. to merge from a version of a model before conflicts were resolved.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project for which you want to do a commit.
  • taskid (str) – The id of the commit operation.
  • toBranch (str) – The name of the target branch. To do a commit within a branch, keep this the same as fromBranch.
  • toModelId (str) – The id of the model you wish to merge to. You can use this e.g. to merge towards a version of a model before conflicts were resolved.
  • userid (str) – The name of the user creating the new branch.
  • contentType (str) – Optional. The format in which you are committing the model. Valid options are: ‘archimate’, ‘json’ and ‘xml’. Default is ‘archimate’.
  • module (str) – Optional. The name of the module to which you want to commit. You can also define new modules this way. By leaving this empty, you commit to the complete model. Default is empty.
  • parserName (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model that is contained in the target branch. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Default is ‘archimate3’.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters (other than module) is not defined or when the query result could not be parsed into a ModelCommit instance.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid or when the query result could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static model_provenance()[source]¶

Retrieve a historic list of all operations on the model over time.

Returns:

An array containing ModelProvenance instances, describing historic events that occurred for the specified model.
Return type:

array<ModelProvenance>
Parameters:

projectName (str) – The name of the project for which you want to retrieve the provenance.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when projectName is not defined or when the query response could not be parsed into ModelProvenance instances.
  • ValueError – Thrown when projectName is not valid or when the query response could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static query_model(taskid)[source]¶

Check on the progress of a commit to the M4I repository. This request will tell you whether the commit is still in progress, completed, has encountered a conflict, or has failed for some other reason. You can use this function for both commit_model, clone_branch and commit_branch.

Returns:

A ModelQuery instance describing the status of the commit operation. If the commit encountered conflicts, the response will also include a list of all the conflicting changes.
Return type:

ModelQuery
Parameters:
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project to which are committing the model.
  • taskid (str) – The id of the commit operation.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not defined or when the query result could not be parsed into a ModelQuery instance.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid or when the query result could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static retrieve_model(projectName, userid, contentType='archimate', modelid='TRUNK', module=None, parserName='archimate3', version=None)[source]¶

Retrieve a model with the given parameters from the M4I repository.

Returns:

A string representation of the model that fits the parameters, parsed to the specified content type (archimate by default).
Return type:

str
Parameters:
  • branchName (str) – The name of the branch containing the model you wish to retrieve.
  • projectName (str) – The name of the project containing the model you wish to retrieve.
  • userid (str) – The id of the user retrieving the model.
  • contentType (str) – Optional. The format in which you wish to retrieve the model. Valid options are: ‘archimate’, ‘json’ and ‘xml’. Default is ‘archimate’.
  • modelid (str) – Optional. The id of the model you wish to retrieve. You can use this e.g. to retrieve a version of a model before conflicts were resolved. Default is ‘TRUNK’.
  • module (str) – Optional. The name of the module you wish to retrieve. By leaving this empty, you retrieve the whole model. Default is empty.
  • parserName (str) – Optional. The name of the meta-model of the model you wish to retrieve. Currently, the only valid option is ‘archimate3’. Default is ‘archimate3’.
  • version (long) – Optional. The timestamp of the version of the model you wish to retrieve. By leaving this empty, you retrieve the latest version. Default is empty.
Raises:
  • TypeError – Thrown when any of the parameters (excluding module and version) is not defined.
  • ValueError – Thrown when any of the parameters is not valid.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
static retrieve_project()[source]¶

Retrieve a project for the given ID from the M4I repository

Returns:

A Project instance representing the project with the given ID
Return type:

Project
Parameters:

projectid (str) – The ID of the project you wish to retrieve
Raises:

  • ValueError – Thrown when projectid is not valid or when the query result could otherwise not be parsed.
  • requests.exceptions.HTTPError – Thrown when the request returned with a 400/500 code variant.
